metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16653 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Symfony before 2.7.38, 2.8.31, 3.2.14, 3.3.13, 3.4-BETA5, and 4.0-BETA5. The current implementation of CSRF protection in Symfony (Version >=2) does not use different tokens for HTTP and HTTPS; therefore the token is subject to MITM attacks on HTTP and can then be used in an HTTPS context to do CSRF attacks.

criterions.comment: symfony: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
